page.title: 07RECREATION
page.content: Very little exists in the way of organised recreation and most people of the block look to Barrow,Dalton or Ulverston for this.The village hall is a social centre and in the case of Leece has bingo sessions and films for children on Saturdays.At Xmas the hall is the scene of the Xmas party.The only scout and guide groups are at Gleaston.The tarn at Leece is used by anglers and fish include perch,tench and roach.The green near the tarn is the site of the village bonfire and the summer fete which has children's sports and stalls.The church hall at Dendron runs a Sunday school and a branch of the Mothers' Union.The two pubs near Leece and Gleaston provide recreation in the form of cards,darts, pool etc.
